data: Daniel Zwanziger Professor Emeritus of Physics Ph.D. 1960 (physics), B.A. 1955 (philosophy), Columbia. Research/Interest: Quantum field theory, particularly the theory of quarks and gluons. External Affiliations Fellow, American Physics Society; New York Academy of Sciences. Fellowships/Honors National Science Foundation Grant, New Numerical Methods for Quantum Field Theory and Critical Phenomena. QCD_4 From a Five-Dimensional Point of View, with Lauren Baulieu. hep-th/9909006. Zero Color Magentization in QCD Matter, with Ismail Zahed. hep-th/9905109. Renormalizable Non-Covariant Gauges and Coulomb Gauge Limit, with Laurent Baulieu. hep-th/9807024. Daniel Zwanziger Professor Emeritus of Physics daniel.zwanziger@nyu.edu 726 Broadway, Room 906 Phone: (212) 998-7732 Collegiate Professor; Professor of Physics Gregory Gabadadze Dean for Science Matthew Kleban Chair of the Department of Physics Massimo Porrati Joshua Ruderman Neal Weiner Director of Undergraduate Studies
